newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt seeks investors to buy preserved food firm.
newsitem.headline: Egypt seeks investors to buy preserved food firm.

text.p: The Egyptian state's Food Industries Company said on Thursday it wanted to sell 90 percent of its subsidiary Kaha Preserved Foods by auction to an anchor investor or group of investors.
Investors may also bid for one or more of Kaha's seven processing plants, it said in a statement.
Kaha has issued capital of 50 million pounds ($14.7 million) divided into five million shares and the state holding company is the sole shareholder, it said.

Kaha has capacity to produce 42,000 tonnes of preserved foods a year but production in the financial year 1995/6 was 17,700 tonnes, against about 18,300 in the previous year. It gave no details of the company's recent profit accounts.
The deadline for bids is June 23. The bid bond will be five million pounds for the 90 percent stake or 500,000 pounds for each factory the investor bids to buy.
